person.persName: James Larmon (Chicago, Illinois, dry goods merchant and real estate investor)

body.p: Chicago, Illinois, dry goods merchant and real estate investor. Kentucky native. Owner of a dry goods store in Paducah, Kentucky, in 1848. Owned three enslaved persons in Paducah in 1850. Owner of warehouses in Paducah and Chicago. Senior partner of James Larmon & Co. in Chicago, with branches in St. Louis, Missouri, and New Orleans, Louisiana. Arrested on November 14, 1864 in Chicago for conspiring with known members of the Order of Sons of Liberty to release prisoners from Camp Douglas, where he was imprisoned.
